ideas.name: Logical Fallacy of the Day
features: Displays a new fallacy each day on page load.
Includes a concise definition and a real-world example.
Provides a 'Pro Tip' on how to spot or counter the fallacy.
Archive view to browse previously featured fallacies.
Simple search functionality to find specific fallacies.

ideas.name: Rhetorical Device Analyzer
features: Text area for user to input text.
Highlights potential rhetorical devices in the text upon analysis.
Clickable highlights that show the definition of the device.
Library of common rhetorical devices with examples.
Option to share the analysis with a permalink.

ideas.name: Socratic Method Question Generator
features: User inputs a core belief or statement.
Generates a series of probing questions based on the input.
Allows user to 'dig deeper' on a specific question, generating follow-ups.
'Save Session' feature to store the question-answer flow.
Export conversation as a text or markdown file.

ideas.name: Analogical Thinking Helper
features: User inputs a complex concept.
Suggests analogous concepts from different domains (e.g., biology, physics, cooking).
Visual mind-map view to connect the concepts.
User can add their own analogies.
Crowdsourced rating system for the best analogies.

ideas.name: Debate Topic Generator
features: Generates a random debate topic with one click.
Filter topics by category (e.g., technology, ethics, pop culture).
Provides 3 'pro' and 3 'con' starting points for the argument.
Timer feature for timed debate practice.
Option to submit new debate topics to a community list.

ideas.name: Historical Timeline Explorer
features: Dual-timeline view to compare two regions or themes.
Zoom and pan functionality for different historical eras.
Clickable events on the timeline with short descriptions and links.
Filter by event type (e.g., war, scientific discovery, art).
User-creatable custom timelines.

ideas.name: Key Philosophers Primer
features: Card-based interface for each philosopher.
Includes a summary of their core ideas, a short bio, and key works.
'Connections' feature showing which other philosophers they influenced or were influenced by.
Interactive quiz to test knowledge of concepts.
Search by philosopher, idea, or historical period.

ideas.name: Speed Reading Trainer
features: User can paste their own text to practice with.
Adjustable speed (Words Per Minute).
Different training modes (e.g., single word flash, chunking).
Comprehension tests after each training session.
Progress tracking chart to show WPM improvement over time.

ideas.name: 'Eisenhower Matrix' To-Do List
features: Drag-and-drop interface to move tasks between the four quadrants.
Color-coded tasks for easy visual identification.
'Focus Mode' which only shows tasks from the 'Urgent & Important' quadrant.
Daily summary of completed tasks.
Ability to add deadlines and reminders to tasks.

ideas.name: Digital Detox Planner
features: Schedule 'offline' blocks in a calendar view.
Set goals for daily or weekly screen time reduction.
Pre-populated list of offline activity suggestions.
Checklist for preparing for a detox session (e.g., notify friends, download music).
Journaling section to note feelings and experiences during the detox.

ideas.name: Meal Prep Suggester
features: User sets dietary preferences (e.g., vegan, low-carb) and number of meals.
Generates a weekly meal plan with one click.
Includes a simple shopping list based on the suggested meals.
Option to 'reroll' individual meal suggestions.
Save favorite meal plans for future use.

ideas.name: Personal Finance Goal Tracker
features: Create multiple savings goals with target amounts and dates.
Visual progress bars for each goal.
Log contributions and see a history of savings.
Calculates required monthly/weekly savings to meet the goal.
Motivational messages when milestones are reached.

ideas.name: 'Idea Inbox' Capture Tool
features: Minimalist interface with a single text input field.
Automatically timestamps every entry.
Tagging system to categorize ideas.
Full-text search through all captured ideas.
Export all ideas as a CSV or JSON file.

ideas.name: Conference/Talk Note Taker
features: Structured template with fields for Speaker, Topic, Key Takeaways, Action Items, and Questions.
Markdown support for formatting notes.
Timer to track talk duration.
Ability to attach a photo (e.g., of a slide).
Export notes to PDF or Markdown format.

ideas.name: Gift Idea Tracker
features: Create profiles for friends and family.
Add gift ideas with links, prices, and notes for each person.
Mark ideas as 'purchased' or 'given'.
Set reminders for birthdays and anniversaries.
Bookmarklet to add ideas directly from shopping websites.

ideas.name: CSS Flexbox & Grid Visualizer
features: Live preview of the layout as you change CSS properties.
Interactive sliders and buttons for properties like `gap`, `justify-content`.
Generates the corresponding HTML and CSS code to copy.
Pre-built templates for common layouts (e.g., holy grail, card grid).
Toggleable guides and outlines to see item dimensions.

ideas.name: Regex Tester
features: Real-time highlighting of matches in the test string.
A library of common regex patterns (e.g., email, URL, phone number).
A 'cheat sheet' explaining common regex tokens.
Support for different regex 'flavors' (e.g., JavaScript, Python).
'Explain Regex' feature that breaks down the pattern in plain English.

ideas.name: Color Palette Generator
features: Generate palettes from a user-uploaded image.
Generate palettes based on a single color using harmony rules (e.g., complementary, triadic).
Adjustable number of colors in the palette.
Export palette as CSS variables, SASS variables, or an image.
Explore popular palettes created by other users.

ideas.name: Simple Markdown Editor
features: Live split-screen preview of the rendered HTML.
Toolbar with buttons for common markdown syntax (e.g., bold, italic, link).
'Copy HTML' and 'Copy Markdown' buttons.
Multiple editor themes (light and dark).
Word and character count.

ideas.name: Code Snippet Manager
features: Syntax highlighting for various programming languages.
Organize snippets with tags and folders.
Full-text search across all snippets.
'Copy to Clipboard' button for each snippet.
Cloud sync via local file or a service like Gist.

ideas.name: JSON Formatter/Validator
features: Automatically formats and indents raw JSON.
Identifies and highlights syntax errors with clear messages.
Collapsible nodes to explore large JSON objects.
'Minify' option to compress JSON into a single line.
Fetch JSON from a URL to validate.

ideas.name: Simple API Request Tool
features: Supports GET, POST, PUT, DELETE requests.
Easy-to-use interface for setting headers and body.
Formatted and highlighted JSON response viewer.
History of recent requests.
Save favorite requests for quick reuse.

ideas.name: Game Theory Simulator
features: Simulate classic games like Hawk-Dove, Stag Hunt, and Prisoner's Dilemma.
Adjust payoffs and see how it affects the optimal strategy.
Run population simulations to see strategies evolve over generations.
Play-by-play log of the simulation.
Explanations of the equilibrium (e.g., Nash Equilibrium) for each game.

ideas.name: Supply and Demand Simulator
features: Interactive graph with draggable supply and demand curves.
Simulate external events like a tax, subsidy, or price ceiling.
Real-time calculation of equilibrium price, quantity, and consumer/producer surplus.
'Scenario' mode with pre-built examples (e.g., housing market, oil prices).
Tutorial mode explaining the basic concepts.

ideas.name: Simple Neural Network Visualizer
features: Visualize a simple network with input, hidden, and output layers.
Adjust weights and biases with sliders to see how the output changes.
Train the network on a simple dataset (e.g., XOR) and watch it learn.
Step-by-step visualization of forward and backward propagation.
Clear explanations of concepts like activation functions and loss.

ideas.name: Logic Gate Simulator
features: Drag-and-drop interface for AND, OR, NOT, XOR, NAND, NOR gates.
Connect gates with wires to build complex circuits.
Toggle inputs to see the signal propagate through the circuit in real-time.
Build and save custom circuits (e.g., a half-adder).
Library of pre-built circuits to explore.

ideas.name: Compound Interest Calculator
features: Interactive sliders for principal, interest rate, time period, and monthly contribution.
Dynamic graph showing the growth of the investment.
Comparison chart to show growth with and without compound interest.
Table view with year-by-year breakdown.
'Future Value' and 'Time to Goal' calculation modes.

ideas.name: Central Limit Theorem Visualizer
features: Choose from different population distributions (e.g., normal, uniform, skewed, bimodal).
Set the sample size and number of samples to draw.
Animated simulation of drawing samples and calculating their means.
Live graph of the sampling distribution of the mean as it builds up.
Overlay a normal curve to see how well it fits.

ideas.name: A/B Test Significance Calculator
features: Simple input fields for visitors and conversions for versions A and B.
Calculates conversion rates, uplift, and statistical significance (p-value).
Clear, plain-English explanation of the results (e.g., 'You can be 95% confident...').
Confidence interval display for the uplift.
Calculates the required sample size for a desired level of significance.

ideas.name: Simple Encryption/Decryption Tool
features: Supports classic ciphers like Caesar, Atbash, and substitution ciphers.
User can input a message and a key (if applicable).
Real-time encryption/decryption as the user types.
'Analyze Text' feature showing letter frequency to aid in breaking ciphers.
Brief explanation of how each cipher works and its historical context.
